
Good call. I updated the code to intercept trailing in subchannel.cc instead of client_channel.cc. Seems much cleaner.

As far as the follow up, I am inclined to keep as is. AKA, the subchannel is the logical connection to a backend, not the actual connection. So if a connection breaks and reconnects, it will maintain the call count.

What do you think @carl-mastrangelo ?
I also incorporated the fix from #16829 into this, so I will close the other

```
[trickle] No significant performance differences
```

> do we want all of the stats to be shown as the same subchannel or different subchannels?

Is it possible to represent multiple sockets being associated with a single subchannel?  If it would be hard, then it seems like a separate subchannel would be right.  After a GOAWAY, logically a subchannel cannot be "load balanced" over, which is the current definition IIRC.  Updating counter in separate subchannels  might be more logical though.  If you knew which subchannel a call was associated with, the id wouldn't change.
